section.title: Binaries
section.p: Please download the appropriate version for your organiser. You can find out what version of Pocket PC you are running by clicking on Start/Settings/About. You are looking for something along the lines of "Pocket PC 2003".

Words like BETA and Release Candidate are used to represent versions that have not yet been released as stable by the development team. You are best to go for the version with the greatest number that is marked stable.
Version numbers such as 4.3 is great than a number such as 4.22 - the 3 is more significant than the 2.

section.title: Data
section.p: This is by far the big important section of any application like this. We have great plans and great code here for generating data from free sources for any area in the world. However it is by no means a trivial task. As such we are building a set of tools to generate the data. To do so we will need about 3 GB of disk storage for the original files. This is not a problem for us long term, but we are not ready for that.
For now, please contact the users list with the data area you need or try and generate it yourself with the tools in CVS.
Here are some we have already prepared

li.a: including: Benalla, Alps, Bayreuth, Germany, Slovakia and UK - more to come

section.p:
Data formats used by XCSoar and sources of data are listed below.
Waypoints: Cambridge .dat format. The Worldwide Soaring Turnpoint Exchange is a good source of waypoint files.
Airspace: OpenAir .txt format. The Worldwide Soaring Turnpoint Exchange has a section on Special Use Airspace.
Glide polars: WinPilot .plr format. These can be obtained from the WinPilot site.
